data.title: Three Mermaid statues in Drøbak, Norway
data.meta_description: The town of Drøbak in Norway has 3 lively mermaid statues by the marina ( Map ), created by Reidar Finsrud, who was commissioned by Ingeborg Lane.
data.text:
The town of Drøbak in Norway has 3 lively mermaid statues by the marina, created by Reidar Finsrud, who was commissioned by Ingeborg Lane. map

Mrs. Lane lived in Drøbak for many years prior to moving to London in 1963, and was well known in the town as she had run a factory there and employed a lot of the citizens. As a thank you to the Drøbak community for the years she lived there, Ingeborg commissioned the mermaid statues and donated them to the city’s marina.

The plaque by the mermaids reads:

“DE TRE HAVFRUER”

Gitt til Drøbak av Ingeborg Drangsholt

med takk for byens store

hjelpsomhet

Translation:

“THE THREE MERMAIDS”

Given to Drøbak by Ingeborg Drangsholt

with thanks for the town’s great

helpfulness

References:

● Ingeborg Lane tribute

● http://www.oblad.no/badebyen/les-intervjuet-med-ingeborg-lane-1.3855285

● http://www.oblad.no/badebyen/populere-havfruer-1.3893585

● The Mermaids of Earth coffee-table book: See page 23 in the book about these sculptures.

Contribute additional pictures of these mermaids here.
